context: "Edukas" is an Estonian adjective meaning 'successful' or 'effective'. It describes someone or something that achieves good results or has positive outcomes. The word can be used for people (students, athletes), activities (work, competitions), or periods of time (beginning, season). In the example sentences, it's shown in different forms: edukas (masculine nominative singular), edukase (genitive/illative form), and eduka (partitive form).
